caption: In addition, they also heard that Hitler's consultant was also likely to be the member of the anti-Nazi organization. If he had learned about the British plan, he would let Hitler believe the information in the letter. Everyone was still anxiously waiting. According to the German telegrams which were deciphered by Britain, Hitler seemed to have transferred most of the soldiers from Sicily to Greece. However, this could also be a strategy to induce Britain to attack Sicily. In the end, Churchill still decided to carry out this plan. On July 30th, 1943, the British soldiers launched an attack on Sicily.
